alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 8:14PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. .The Milk River will slowly drop or remain steady over the next couple days. For the Milk River...including Tampico and Glasgow, Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Flooding will begin to affect buildings between the Fort Peck Highway and the Milk River east of Glasgow. Sullivan Park will be totally covered by flood waters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 31.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM MDT Tuesday was 31.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 30.3 feet Wednesday evening. It is then expected to rise to 31.2 feet early Friday afternoon. It will fall to 29.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 1130 AM MDT.
